pages.title: Omphalophloios
pages.text: $(l)Temporal Range:$() Carboniferous$(br2)$(l)Propagation:$() $(l:basics/collecting_plants)Spore-bearing plants$(/l)$(br2)$(l)Growth:$() Grows from a sapling which can be planted on all dirt-like blocks.

For general details on the Lepidodendrales Order, see $(l:plants/lepidodendron)Lepidodendron$(/l). Omphalophloios is thought to have grown far smaller than most of its relatives, forming a shrub-height single-stemmed plant with a network of small branches forming a less expansive messy crown. It may have branched. It is identified, like most, from distinctive leaf base patterns and stem morphology, which are however very similar to Lepidodendron.
